meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by a small object hitting a hard surface.
meanings.sent1: The tchick of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a tchick when the pebble hit the window.
meanings.sent3: The tchick of the acorn hitting my head made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The tchick of the drumsticks on the drum signaled the start of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The tchick of the door closing behind her filled the silent room.

meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: She tchicked her tongue to get the attention of her dog.
meanings.sent2: The branches tchick against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent3: He tchicked his fingers together in a nervous habit.
meanings.sent4: The clock tchicked softly as time passed by.
meanings.sent5: The old floorboards tchick under our feet as we walked.

meanings.definition: A small, sharp object used for sewing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully threaded the tchick through the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The tailor reached for a tchick to mend the torn shirt.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the shiny tchick from the sewing kit.
meanings.sent4: The tchick pricked my finger as I hurriedly sewed the button.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tchick gleamed in the sunlight as it lay on the table.
